intro: Diodonta bidentoides, commonly known as the two-toothed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow composite flowers that develop into fluffy, white seed heads. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland and rocky habitats. Diodonta bidentoides is adapted to arid conditions and has a long flowering period, typically from late winter to early summer.
